title: TIDES Data Package
description: TIDES Data Package is a simple specification for data access and delivery of tabular TIDES transit data.

profile.title: Profile
profile.description: The json-schema profile used to validate this datapackage descriptor. Should be `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TIDES-transit/TIDES/<spec-version-or-reference>/spec/tides-datapackage-profile.json`. Defaults to `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TIDES-transit/TIDES/main/spec/tides-datapackage-profile.json`

csvddfVersion.title: CSV Dialect schema version
csvddfVersion.description: A number to indicate the schema version of CSV Dialect. Version 1.0 was named CSV Dialect Description Format and used different field names.

delimiter.title: Delimiter
delimiter.description: A character sequence to use as the field separator.

doubleQuote.title: Double Quote
doubleQuote.description: Specifies the handling of quotes inside fields.
doubleQuote.context: If Double Quote is set to true, two consecutive quotes must be interpreted as one.

lineTerminator.title: Line Terminator
lineTerminator.description: Specifies the character sequence that must be used to terminate rows.

nullSequence.title: Null Sequence
nullSequence.description: Specifies the null sequence, for example, `\N`.

quoteChar.title: Quote Character
quoteChar.description: Specifies a one-character string to use as the quoting character.

escapeChar.title: Escape Character
escapeChar.description: Specifies a one-character string to use as the escape character.

skipInitialSpace.title: Skip Initial Space
skipInitialSpace.description: Specifies the interpretation of whitespace immediately following a delimiter. If false, whitespace immediately after a delimiter should be treated as part of the subsequent field.

header.title: Header
header.description: Specifies if the file includes a header row, always as the first row in the file.

commentChar.title: Comment Character
commentChar.description: Specifies that any row beginning with this one-character string, without preceeding whitespace, causes the entire line to be ignored.

caseSensitiveHeader.title: Case Sensitive Header
caseSensitiveHeader.description: Specifies if the case of headers is meaningful.
caseSensitiveHeader.context: Use of case in source CSV files is not always an intentional decision. For example, should "CAT" and "Cat" be considered to have the same meaning.
